Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani delivered the knockout punch on this night with a three-run homer against Tylor Megill in the eighth.
Enrique Hernandez’s two-run homer in the sixth widened the Dodgers’ lead to 4-0.
Muncy homered against Megill leading off the ninth to bury the Mets in an 8-0 hole.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Carlos Mendoza said he would expect to keep right-handed hitting options such as slumping Jose Iglesias and J.D. Martinez in the lineup.
The manager also plans to stick with slumping Francisco Alvarez.
Mendoza said he is pretty confident the Mets will come through.
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor said the Mets didn’t give the fans what they came to see.
Manager Carlos Mendoza said the Mets are creating traffic on base, but haven’t been able to come up with the big hit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets barely posed a threat, resembling the team that had disappeared meekly into the Hollywood night in Game 1 of this NLCS.
The Mets are trying to regain even footing, following an 8-0 loss in Game 3 at Citi Field that tilted the series in the Dodgers’ favor.
Others: The challenge won’t get any easier on Thursday, when Dodgers ace Yoshinobu Yamamoto is scheduled to face Jose Quintana in Game 4.
Reed Garrett said the Mets can come back from an 8-0 deficit, citing their comeback win in Game 1.
